text: "Old Pop in an Oak" is a song recorded by the Swedish band Rednex. It was released in November 1994 as the second single from their debut album, Sex & Violins. The song reached number-one in many countries, including Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Finland, and Sweden. ==Critical reception== Lennox Herald wrote in their review, that "Old Pop in an Oak" is a "similar sounding song" to their "Cotton Eye Joe" song. Manila Standard described it as "techno-pop fun". ==Chart performance== "Pop in an Oak" was very successful on the charts in Europe, remaining one of the group's biggest hits to date. It peaked at number-one in Austria, Denmark, Finland, Norway and Sweden. Additionally, the single managed to climb into the Top 10 also in Belgium, Germany, Iceland, the Netherlands, Scotland and Switzerland, as well as on the Eurochart Hot 100, where it reached number 2. In the United Kingdom, "Old Pop in an Oak" went to number 12 in its first week at the UK Singles Chart, on March 19, 1995. In France, it was a Top 50 hit. Outside Europe, the single peaked at number 7 in New Zealand, number 17 on the RPM Dance Chart and number 53 on the RPM Singles Chart in Canada, and number 70 in Australia. It earned a gold record in Switzerland and a platinum record in Austria, Germany and Norway. ==Music video== The music video for "Old Pop in an Oak" was directed by Swedish director Stefan Berg, who also directed the music video for "Cotton Eye Joe". The video was uploaded to YouTube in August 2013.
